newsitem.title: USA: CFI ProServices withdraws share offering.
newsitem.headline: CFI ProServices withdraws share offering.

text.p: CFI ProServices Inc said Thursday it has withdrawn its public offering of 1.55 million shares of common stock.

The company said in a statement the decision was based upon its belief that the recent stock prices, at which the offering would have been priced, do not adequately reflect the value of the company and would dilute value for its existing shareholders.
"CFI has an obligation to our existing shareholders not to dilute value because of an aberrationally low stock price," said Matt Chapman, chairman and chief executive officer.

"We simply do not feel that the current market adequately reflects our historic ability to grow revenue and earnings. The withdrawal of this offering will not change our strategy of pursuing growth, both internally and through acquisitions," he added.
CFI said it has has ample liquidity to run current operations, and will finance acquisitions through other alternatives. CFI has over 4.8 million shares outstanding.
